result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory James Chaltry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
Joint and several. Paid in full.
 ($1,000.00 paid by co-defendant on 4-29-16)
Balance paid from money on deposit and disbursed to victim on 7-13-16.

No employment where defendant would be in a position where he is supervising cash.
Employment as approved by agent.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 9-8-16.
DNA surcharge paid from money on deposit.

No contact with Krist Oil store or their properties.
Absolute sobriety to include no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and  as approved by agent.

Pay DNA surcharge, all other costs remitted.
Assessments, counseling and follow through as determined by agent.
Court adopts all conditions as listed on page 16 of Pre-Sentence Investigation.

timeConds.notes: Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
